The goal of this post is to give a quick introduction to measures of central tendency - which is a fancy way of saying, how can we use a single number to summarize the contents of a data set.

These are widely taught in pretty much every stats class, so here we will focus on conceptual meaning and use rather than formulas.

Lets start with a simple data set for illustrative purposes with only five numbers: $(1, 4, 5, 10, 10)$

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
